item.title: Overflowing shop bin fell on the road, 2nd August
item.description:
Litter bin of the village shop was again left overflowing on the street. It fell and spread all the litter around in the whole street. This is disgusting and a recurrent issue that hasn’t been solved. These commercial litter bins should be kept on premises not on the public street. Please could you handle this urgently before it spreads further and cause an accident? Kind regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Full and overflowing bin, 2nd August
item.description:
The dog waste bin at the top of Forty Foot Way going into the park has overflowed and there are bags piling up all over the ground underneath it now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rocking manhole on road (west-east direction), 2nd August
item.description:

item.title: Stinking wheelie bin kept on the pavement, 2nd August
item.description:
The bin has been there for years even though it been reported loads of times. There is also a work truck parked on the pavement so you have to squeeze past that then past a stinking bin
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carnach Green, South Ockendon

item.title: Residential house using small park bins for household waste, 2nd August
item.description:
For months I have noticed an increased level of litter in the park behind however with visiting the park 3 times a day I have not seen anyone having picnics other than other dog walkers. Park is full of your household waste like food, plastic wrappers, baby nappies and sanitary pads! I have put multiple requests in to bexley to clean up the park however today I have caught the culprit of number 40 using their rear garden gate, walking over to the bin in the park with a carrier bag of waste and another with glass bottles I’m sure the fox’s will have a field day and another visit from bexley will be needed to tidy the park up (again)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selkirk Drive, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Andover Estate (again), 2nd August
item.description:
Three of many dumped on the estate. Lime do not care nor does the council about allowing them to be unlocked easily and then used by kids and then dumped. Every single day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Road, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lighting, 2nd August
item.description:
No lights in the play park grounds this is the area to walk in by the gym leisure centre women walking early mornings do not have adequate lighting and feel scared. Please can you install some lighting around the park path the one in avenue rd close to the erith leisure centre.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lesney Park Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
